Home → New in and suggestions → Music → New music for December 2014

New music for December 2014

Classics by She & Him

American indie duo Zooey Deschanel and M. Ward take on pop and jazz standards, walking a fine line between charming and cloying. You’ll either love the comfortable familiarity or hate it.

The Chicken & the Egg by George the Poet

Social and political spoken word artist George Mpanga AKA George the Poet explores absent fatherhood through the story of a rocky relationship.

Live in Dublin by Leonard Cohen

Masterful performance from Cohen’s sold-out 2012-2013 world tour. His second new release this year.

Live in concert by John Grant with The BBC Philharmonic Orchestra

One-off live recording with the 60-piece BBC Philharmonic Orchestra, with arrangements by long-time collaborator Fiona Brice.

FOUR by One Direction (Freegal)

Four marks One Direction’s longevity in the boy band business with their catchy pop songs.

Sonic Highways by Foo Fighters (Freegal)

Each song written and recorded in eight cities, Foo Fighters explore how each region shaped them in their formative years, and in turn the impact they had on the cultural fabric of their hometowns.

The Greatest Hits by Luther Vandross (Freegal)

One of the greatest male vocalists of all time, Luther Vandross’ unique ability to write and sing emotive songs has seen his tracks resonate long since he passed away in 2005.

Hope by Susan Boyle (Freegal)

This versatile collection shows off her singing talent across genres.
